selection_matrix.intended_use: Use lattice proofs to set hard boundaries when encountering TREE(3)-class combinatorial growth.
Not recommended: selector lacks boundary semantics without added proof hooks.
Deterministic, side-effect-free context can host TREE(3) halt triggers tied to governance invariants.
Period-3 optimality and C3 invariance provide mathematical thresholds for stopping criteria.
Contract enforces alignment but is not itself a TREE(3) boundary detector.
Proof-stage theorems (insufficiency of 2, sufficiency of 3) map to phase transitions across reasoning regimes.
Selector is operational; lacks formal phase markers.
Context executes scoring but does not encode constructive/non-constructive transitions.

Deterministic context can host TREE(3) caps while enforcing invariants.
C3-invariant projection plus E(n) efficiency offers mathematical throttling criteria.
Contract gating can be extended with TREE(3) ceilings to block unsafe state admissions.
